intro: Strobilanthes afriastiniae, commonly known as the African flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in the wild.
